body:
makes sense, can you send a pull request?

> On a related note, you don't have any tests for the js validation code, right?

we currently do not have any, do you have an idea how to easily set up testing for these?

Yeah, I have set up mocha for javascript unit testing in my Yii apps. There's a small Yii app inside the test directory with a single controller and a single view that loads mocha + a bunch of libraries (chai, sinon, leche and their connectors), the asset bundles to be tested and their corresponding test asset bundles, and then uses [mocha-phantomjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mocha-phantomjs) to run the tests.
Travis unfortunately doesn't support multiple languages, so [you have to manually install npm using nvm](http://austinpray.com/ops/2015/09/20/change-travis-node-version.html) if you want to have npm in your project. And it's probably going to run the mocha tests for each php version needlessly.

Here's a prototype: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/compare/master...nkovacs:mocha
You can open the index-test.php file in a browser to run the tests. I haven't set up travis yet, and a lot of the code is really ugly and hacky, but some of that is also unavoidable, since I wanted to use `clientValidateAttribute` to generate the options used by the js code instead of hardcoding it into the js test file.
cool, thanks. will check it out.

issue.title: #12840: Added unit tests for yii.validation.js

labels.name: status:under development
labels.description: Someone is working on a pull request.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes, it contains some bug fixes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #12840

Used @nkovacs draft as starting point(https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/11037#issuecomment-193356450). I also fixed some bugs in `yii.validation.js` and did some refactoring.

## Implemented tests

- yii.validation.js

## Running tests

- JS tests use jQuery and Punycode.js libraries from `vendor/bower` to match those that are used in assets and prevent installing and synchronizing duplicates via NPM. So make sure you have them installed. If no - run `composer install` to install them via Composer Asset Plugin.
- Install Node.js. I used the latest version available at the moment - `v7.1.0`. Note that used `jsdom` dependent library version requires `Node.js >= 4`.
- Run `npm install` to install dependencies.
- Execute `npm test` for running tests.

## Problems list

- [x] Sinon can not be installed via Composer Asset Plugin. If I add line `"npm-asset/sinon": "^1.17.6"` to `required-dev` section of `composer.json` and run `composer update` I get the following error:

```
[RuntimeException]
Failed to execute git clone --mirror 'git+ssh://git@github.com/sinonjs/sinon.git' '/home/vagrant/.composer/cache/vcs/git-ssh---git-github.com-sinonjs-sinon.git/'
Cloning into bare repository '/home/vagrant/.composer/cache/vcs/git-ssh---git-github.com-sinonjs-sinon.git'...
Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists.
```

Possibly related: https://github.com/fxpio/composer-asset-plugin/issues/187.

I tried `--prefer-dist` option, that didn't help. I also have generated SSH key and it's added it to `ssh-agent` (error is mentioned in [git-workflow](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/docs/internals/git-workflow.md#1-fork-the-yii-repository-on-github-and-clone-your-fork-to-your-development-environment) document which is a part of internal docs).

This is not actual anymore because Node.js and NPM are used for testing.

- [x] Sometimes "image validator with FileReader API is not available" test takes a long time to load and gives warning with time written inside of a red label. This is because of swapping native `FileReader`:

```js
var initialFileReader = FileReader;

beforeEach(function () {
    FileReader = undefined;
});

afterEach(function () {
    FileReader = initialFileReader;
});
```

But:

- It happens pretty seldom and increases time by about half of second only.
- I can't see a better solution for testing this, so this is not a big problem.
- Similar technique is used for swapping native JS components in other places.

So this is not a big deal.

This is not actual anymore because Node.js and NPM are used for testing and for testing that case different approach is used.

- [x] Run tests in command line instead of a browser.

Node.js and NPM are used for testing.

- [x] Error while running `npm test`:

> Error: timeout of 15000ms exceeded. Ensure the done() callback is being called in this test.

Happens very seldom, this is because of jsdom and integrating jQuery. Default timeout is 2000ms. And this is always not enough, so I increased it to be 15000ms.

Solved with increasing timeout to 30s, see #13160.

- [x] In build detailed info the line after "with width more than minimum width" (validateImage method, with successfully read image) is not printed. It's OK locally though.

Can't see it in some builds, maybe it was Travis glitch related with formatting.

It's gone in the latest builds, for example in [this one](https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/jobs/182190268).

## Integration with Travis CI

I found this [article](https://ma27.github.io/travis-ci/2016/05/06/travis-for-nodejs-and-php.html) and used it as starting point.

> TravisCI uses the software which is shipped by default on a `precise`: An ancient setup with NodeJS 0.10 and NPM 1.x. The current 3.x series of NPM is much more stable than the ancient NPM 1.x and fixed a lot of misbehavior which has been implemented in the older versions of NPM. Especially code which has been written for the browser will experience issues due to some implementation details of NPM releases prior to the 3.x series.

We can't use Node.js < 4 because of [jsdom](https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom) dependency. I refused to use [3.x branch](https://github.com/tmpvar/jsdom/tree/3.x) of jsdom because it's considered legacy and no longer maintained.

I tried to change dist to `trusty` and install newer versions of Node.js and NPM. It worked, but another error appeared during creating test MySQL database:

```
- mysql -e 'CREATE DATABASE yiitest;';
```

Error's text:

> ERROR 2002 (HY000): Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock' (2)

Then I found https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6842 and fixed it with installation of MySQL 5.6 (default is MySQL 5.5 for trusty dist).

Hovewer new problems appeared.

- [x] On PHP 5.4:

> Warning: PHP Startup: Unable to load dynamic library
> '/home/travis/.phpenv/versions/5.4.45/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-zts-20100525/apc.so' -
> /home/travis/.phpenv/versions/5.4.45/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-zts-20100525/apc.so:
> cannot open shared object file: 
> No such file or directory in Unknown on line 0

Related: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6853

I'm trying to fix it by installing PECL package, see this [article](http://olvlvl.com/2016-09-travis-apc). Hovewer no results yet, because it tries to install it for PHP 7 version (that's weird because version in the build is 5.4).

Fixed.

- [x] On HHVM 2 tests related with PostgreSQL are now failing.

Specified 3.6 version for testing (the same as on Precise), created separate issues - #12981, #12982.

- [x] Get rid of oauth token, #12987.

issue.title: Making JS tests ready to go into master

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
This PR contains the changes from #12936 by @arogachev as well as improved travis-ci configuration for NodeJS. I have squashed the work on JS tests to one commit as they were not applicable on current master (contained a lot of changes and reverts):

>   **Implemented Javascript test suite**
>    
>    fixes #12840
>    
>    Used @nkovacs draft as starting
>    point(https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/11037#issuecomment-193356450).
>    I also fixed some bugs in `yii.validation.js` and did some refactoring.
>    
>    Implemented tests:
>    
>    - yii.validation.js
>    
>    Running tests:
>    
>    - Install Node.js. I used the latest version available at the moment -
>      `v7.1.0`. Note that used `jsdom` dependent library version requires
>    `Node.js >= 4`.
>    - Run `npm install` to install dependencies.
>    - Execute `npm test` for running tests.


I have already merged the adjustements made to the travis-ci setup to master: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/compare/729ddc5b76e8159d051e9c5783f5534eeb212efb...47ece37b5af8c3b21dc551724ba73ba5e66b40db
In combination with #13100 by @rob006 the build seems to be quite stable to me.

The changes have already been reviewed and commented in #12936. lets have a second look at what has changed in `yii.validation.js` and get this ready to be merged.

Huge thanks to @arogachev already for preparing this and all others participating for the input.

- JS is now a separate branch in the travis test suite: https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/builds/180400521
- here is the build log: https://travis-ci.org/yiisoft/yii2/jobs/180400530
